comment.author: 25752562@N07
comment._content: Trajan's Kiosk is the structure at the right. The entire complex is no longer on Philae Island proper, but was moved to the neighboring island of Agilkai because of chronic flooding after construction of the Aswan Dam.

comment.author: 27703725@N00
comment._content: No doubt the biggest difference, only these coffers were left after the Philae temple complex was moved when the Aswan High Dam was built in the 1970s: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/travlr/3020366735/] More of the story here: www.touregypt.net/featurestories/Philae.htm

comment.author: 11183235@N02
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Strictly Ptolemaic, and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 57758225@N07
comment._content: This is only one reason why I took look at this picture is because it looks so unusual  surrounding by big water.  The real Egypt is a desert, it was USSR who helped them last time in 70th.

comment.author: 7588563@N04
comment._content: This photo was probably taken before the construction of the Aswan Dam, it sits right on the Nile River.
